Word.Root: Hit or hurt or smote or wound one's liver, affect anyone painfully (e.g. by intense cold), purpose a thing. Large, thick or big in the middle. To have complaint or pain of the liver, face difficulty, struggle against difficulty or severity or trouble, reach in the middle. Liver; middle part; become in the middle or main part of something. Misery, distress, affliction, trouble or obstacle. Cavity of the belly. Hard struggle. Inside or interior (e.g. of the earth). Also, centre or side.
Word.MeaningSimple: Liver pains, to put someone in toiling struggle, face difficulty.

Meaning.Definition: كَبَدَ [aor. يَكْبُدُ and يَكْبِدُ inf. noun كَبْدٌ ] كَبَدَهٗ To be inflicted severely.
Meaning.Example: كَبَدَهُمُ الْبَرَدُ The cold affected them severely.

Meaning.Definition: Distressed, straitened. كَبَدٌ : Distress; trouble, difficulty.
Meaning.Example: وَقَعَ فِىْ كَبَدٍ : He fell into difficulty.
Token(90:5:1:5) We have created man to face hardships; or in a right or just state, in just proportion (90:5).
